title.narrative: OPT 4.3. MULTI-STAKEHOLDER MOVEMENT ACTIVELY PROMOTES AND ADVOCATES FOR FULFILMEN

description.narrative: The agenda of the corporate sector and media promotes and advocates for children's rights at national- and sub-national level in the four departments receiving UNICEF support., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children, especially the most disadvantaged, including those affected by climate change, are prioritized within the national development agenda.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The agenda of the corporate sector and media promotes and advocates for children?s rights at national- and sub-national level inthe four departments receiving UNICEF support.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to mobilize and engage Bolivian society to gain support for putting children at the core of the public agenda during the second year of the pandemic. Several initiatives and campaigns were strengthened to respond to the pandemic during 2021 and their audiences grew while they positioned UNICEF as the main national actor promoting children’s rights. Partnerships with the private sector and civil society were strengthened and linkages with the business sector provided new opportunities for advocacy and social mobilization. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/12/2021
